definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Guillotine is a masterpiece of Aitmatov in 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 《断头台》是艾特玛托夫八十年代的力作。

sentences.english: The world mocks at it, and sometimes puts one in the pillory of it.
sentences.chinese: 世人对它大加嘲笑，有时甚至因它把人送上断头台。

sentences.english: Many members of the aristocracy were guillotined in France during the Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 大革命时期法国许多贵族被送上断头台。

sentences.english: The scaffold forms part of the fte.
sentences.chinese: 断头台是狂欢节必不可少的一部分。

sentences.english: They were promptly 2 returned to Paris and eventually guillotined.
sentences.chinese: 他们马上被送回巴黎，最后送上断头台。

sentences.english: He shoved the Hand around to stand in front of the block.
sentences.chinese: 他把魔手修推向前，让他站在断头台前面。

sentences.english: The warders —staggering under the weight-hauled the block out into the courtyard and placed it in front of Magicka.
sentences.chinese: 断头台太重，狱卒蹒跚拖到大院中，停在法师面前。

sentences.english: He dreams of scaffolds as he smokes his hookah pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他抽起水烟筒，梦想着断头台。

sentences.english: They placed the Priest in the guillotine facing up and released the blade.
sentences.chinese: 他们把牧师放在断头台上，放下铡刀。

sentences.english: All the people had to rush to the guillotine save WangXiaoGong and MeiXianZu.
sentences.chinese: 众百姓都要冲到断头台上救下王小红和梅贤祖。

definition: to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
Robespierre (name)/Maximilien François Marie Isidore de Robespierre (1758-1794), French revolutionary leader, enthusiastic advocate of reign of terror 1791-1794
Jacobin club, French revolutionary party that played a leading role in the reign of terror 1791-1794
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
an execution/to put sb to death
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
